intro: Urvillea dissecta, commonly known as the dissected urvillea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink or purple flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the wet season. Urvillea dissecta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides.
